revised_title: Duality-Reggeons and Resonances in Elementary Particle Processes: Generalized Interference Model
tldr: The article discusses the resonance interpretation of phase shift analyses in elementary particle processes, focusing on duality-Reggeons and the generalized interference model. The authors explore the properties of resonance states, their correlation via the symmetric quark model, and the success of the interference model in explaining high-energy backward scattering. They also introduce the concept of the generalized interference model as a possible alternative to duality.
